Detailed Description

Oracle Database connectivity.

Note:
Oracle (OCI8) requires the oci8 pecl extension to be installed. You can do this by running: 
 pecl install oci8

Member Function Documentation

availableMethods (  ) 

Class methods available to this query handle. 

 $features = $dbh->availableMethods();
 if(in_array($features, 'getDatabaseTables'))
   $tables = $dbh->getDatabaseTables();
 else echo "Uh-oh, getDatabaseTables() has not been implemented for {$dbh->engine()}";
Returns:
An array of available methods.

Implements CMDatabaseProtocol.

bindValues ( $  sql,
$  values = false 
)

Use internally by query() and insert() for substituting values. 

 select * from mytable where id=? and name=?

to 

 select * from mytable where id='3' and name='Bob'
Parameters:
$sql SQL
$values The values to bind.
Returns:
New bound string.

Definition at line 495 of file CMOracle.php.

CMOracle ( $  uri,
$  a = false 
)

Connect to a database.

Note:
This connection method only supports Oracle SID authentication.

Database connections are made with a URI in the form of; 

 oracle://<user>:<pass>@<location>/<sid>

 $dbh = new CMOracle("oracle://scott:tiger@localhost/orcl");
Throws a CMError Error
See CMError::throwError(). If the schema is invalid. Only 'oracle' is supported.
Throws a CMError Error
See CMError::throwError(). If the connection was unsuccessful.
Parameters:
$uri Connection URI.
$a An associative array of server options when connecting.

Name Required Description
ORACLE_HOME No The location of the Oracle Database home. If you do not provide this value it will be taken from the Apache which much be set up manually.
LD_LIBRARY_PATH No The location of the Oracle Database library include path. If you do not set this, the value will be $ORACLE_HOME/lib

COMMIT transaction.

Note:
This function is only relevant if you use setAutoCommit(false) before running any statements.

Definition at line 646 of file CMOracle.php.

eraseTable ( $  tableName  ) 

Erase (not truncate) a table.

Erasing a table removes all the entries of the table by deleteing each row. It is effectivly: 

 DELETE FROM $tableName WHERE 1;

This has a higher overhead than truncateTable() because it requires space in the UNDO log.

Parameters:
$tableName The name of the table.
Returns:
true for success, otherwise false (such as if the table doesn't exist or you do not have adequate privileges.)
See also:
truncateTable()

Implements CMDatabaseProtocol.

Definition at line 564 of file CMOracle.php.

insert ( $  name,
$  kv = false,
$  a = false 
)

INSERT statement

Warning:
Unlink the other protocols, this function will only return the success of the query and not the newly created key.

This uses a key-value paired array to construct an INSERT statement like:

 $dbh->insert('mytable', array('a' => 'Something', 'b' => 123.45));

Will produce and execute the following SQL: 

 insert into mytable (a, b) values ('Something', '123.45')
Throws a CMError Warning
See CMError::throwWarning(). If the query failed. 'sql' attribute contains the original SQL.
Parameters:
$name The name of the table.
$kv Associative array of fields and data.
$a Extra options.

Implements CMDatabaseProtocol.

Definition at line 626 of file CMOracle.php.

query ( $  sql,
$  values = false,
$  a = false 
)

Perform a query on the database that returns a handle to iterate the results.

For actions that do not require a result use execute().

Throws a CMError Warning
See CMError::throwWarning(). If the query was unable to be executed.
Parameters:
$sql SQL.
$values An array of values to bind to $sql.
$a An associative array of server options for the query.
Returns:
New CMOracleQuery object regardless of success or failure.
See also:
execute()

Implements CMDatabaseProtocol.

Definition at line 674 of file CMOracle.php.

setAutoCommit ( $  mode = false  ) 

Turn autocommit on/off.

By default this is off. When turning off auto commit you will have to manually commit the transaction with commit() or undo with rollback()

Parameters:
$mode true or false.
Returns:
Always true.
See also:
commit()
rollback()

Implements CMDatabaseProtocol.

Definition at line 576 of file CMOracle.php.

truncateTable ( $  tableName  ) 

TRUNCATE table.

truncateTable() uses the TRUNCATE statement with the default Oracle settings. It is effectivly: 

 TRUNCATE $tableName;
Parameters:
$tableName The name of the table.
Returns:
true for success, otherwise false (such as if the table doesn't exist or you do not have adequate privileges.)

Implements CMDatabaseProtocol.
